projects.title: AI Resume Analyzer
projects.cardBlurb: AI-powered resume reviewer that scores resumes, extracts skills, and returns actionable improvements in seconds.
projects.summary: A client-first resume analysis tool that parses uploaded CVs, extracts structured data (skills, experience, education), and uses LLM-based scoring and recommendations to optimize resumes for job descriptions. Built as a single-page app with persistent storage, user auth, and on-demand AI processing.
projects.longDescription: Built to automate and improve resume feedback for early-career engineers and students. Users upload a resume (PDF/DOCX), the app extracts text, maps skills/roles to standardized tags, compares against target job descriptions, and generates an explainable score with prioritized suggestions (format, keywords, achievements, ATS-friendliness). The UI focuses on fast feedback and clear, actionable edits a candidate can apply immediately.
projects.role: Sole developer — frontend + backend integration, AI prompt design, storage and CI/CD.
keyFeatures: Resume upload (PDF/DOCX) with client-side processing fallback
LLM-driven scoring and line-by-line improvement suggestions
Compare resume vs. job description — gap analysis
User accounts and persistent resume history

impact.improvementRate: replace_with_% (e.g., % of users who accepted suggestions)

notableChallengesAndSolutions: Accurate extraction from varied PDF formats — solved with hybrid client-side parsing + server sanitization.
Keeping prompts deterministic — built standardized templates and few-shot examples; implemented temperature control and result validation.
Privacy / credentials — used Puter.js to avoid exposing API keys and store minimal PII client-side where possible.

Describe tradeoffs: latency vs accuracy, and privacy choices
nextSteps: Add A/B testing for suggestion templates and measure acceptance
Export actionable checklist PDF for users

projects.title: EMT Chat — Real-time Team Chat
projects.cardBlurb: Real-time group & direct messaging with file uploads, presence, and admin dashboard — built for small teams and learning communities.
projects.summary: A modern chat application with real-time messaging, typing indicators, file/image uploads, message search, and an admin dashboard for moderating channels and users. The app emphasizes responsiveness, accessible UI, and simple deployment.
projects.longDescription: Designed as a production-capable chat demo: sockets power instant messages and presence; a REST API handles file uploads and search indexing; the admin panel provides message moderation, user management, and analytics. Security features like rate-limiting and bot protection are integrated, plus reliable media handling via Cloudinary.
projects.role: Full-stack implementation: realtime backend, message persistence, file storage integration, and responsive frontend.
keyFeatures: File/image uploads using Cloudinary and secure URLs
Admin dashboard: user/channel moderation and analytics
Basic security: rate-limits and bot protection (Arcjet)
notableChallengesAndSolutions: Scaling realtime events — used efficient room partitioning and lightweight message payloads.
Preventing spam/uploads abuse — integrated Arcjet for bot detection and server-side validation.
Handling large file uploads — implemented server-side streaming and Cloudinary transforms to optimize delivery.
readmeChecklist: Socket.io event list and payload examples
Deployment notes for Render and production tips
demoTalkingPoints: Show live multi-user chat and presence indicators
Demonstrate file upload, email notification, and moderation flow

nextSteps: Add end-to-end encryption option for private channels
Message search with fuzzy matching and attachments indexing
